titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Reproductive Health and Population (RHP), Office Files of Margaret Hempel and Jose Barzelatto
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Reproductive Health and Population (RHP), Office Files of Margaret Hempel and Jose Barzelatto FA614

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-03-01 01:30:25 -0500.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Reproductive Health and Population (RHP), Office Files of Margaret Hempel and Jose Barzelatto

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in 3 series by file type.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, trip files and subject files.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Margaret Hempel is a foundation executive who worked at the Ford Foundation during two different spans of time. She initially joined the Foundation as an Assistant Program Officer in its Urban Poverty Program before moving to its Reproductive Health and Population Program (RHP) in 1990 as an Assistant Program Officer. She was then promoted to Program Officer and then Deputy Director until a change in the Foundation's programming converted RHP to the Human Development and Reproductive Health unit (HDRH) of the Asset Building and Community Development Program (ASSETS) in 1996. From then until she left the Foundation in 1999, she served as a Deputy Director of HDRH. Hempel later returned to the Foundation as Director of the Gender, Racial, and Ethnic Justice Program.

In between her two different stints at the Ford Foundation, Hempel served as Vice President for Programs at the American Jewish World Service and Vice President for Programs at the Ms. Foundation for Women. She became a Consultant for the Girls First Fund after her second time at the Ford Foundation.
Hempel earned a B.A. from John Hopkins University and an M.A. from Princeton University.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jose Barzelatto (1926-2006) was an endocrinologist, nuclear medicine physician, foundation executive, and reproductive and sexual health advocate who worked for several years at the Ford Foundation. Barzelatto initially started as a Senior Program Advisor at the Urban Poverty Program and then became Director of the Reproductive Health and Population Program (RHP).

Prior to joining the Ford Foundation, Barzelatto had positions as a professor of medicine at the University of Chile and as Director of the Special Program of Research, Development, and Research Training at the World Health Organization (WHO). After leaving the Foundation, he became Vice President of the Center for Health and Social Policy.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Ford Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.
